question.body: Varicose veins occur when valves are not functioning properly and blood that should be flowing towards the heart pools in the vein. Varicose veins are more common in the legs. Which of the following is the best explanation for this?

multiple_choice.choice: Varicose veins are more common in the legs because there is more blood in the legs.
Varicose veins are more common in the legs because there are larger veins.
Varicose veins are more common in the legs because there are more valves in the legs.
Varicose veins are more common in the legs

response.feedback: Incorrect. The volume of blood does not cause the varicose veins.
Incorrect. The largest veins are located in the stomach, chest and neck.
Correct. Because the blood must flow against gravity to return to the heart there are more valves in the legs to prevent backflow.
Incorrect. The legs are further from the heart and the blood must flow against gravity to return to the heart.

part.hint: Think about where in your body gravity will pull the blood down the most.
